rules.title: Game Rules
rules.welcome: Welcome to the 200 Card Game! This is a partnership trick-taking game for 4 players where North and South play against East and West.

gettingStartedItems.createJoin: Create or Join a Table: Use the lobby to create a new table or join an existing one
gettingStartedItems.tableSettings: Table Settings: Choose between 36-card (standard) or 40-card (with kitty) decks
gettingStartedItems.scoreTargets: Score Targets: Set your game to 200, 300, 500, or 1000 points
gettingStartedItems.privateTables: Private Tables: Create password-protected tables for private games
gettingStartedItems.botPlayers: Bot Players: Add AI bots to fill empty seats with different skill levels

rules.cardDescription: The game uses either a 36-card deck (A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-5) or 40-card deck (A-K-Q-J-10-9-8-7-6-5) depending on your table settings.
rules.flowDescription: The game is fully automated in this interface. The system handles all dealing, shuffling, and turn management automatically.

flowItems.automaticDealing: Automatic Dealing: Cards are dealt automatically to all players
flowItems.turnIndicators: Turn Indicators: The interface shows whose turn it is with visual cues
flowItems.timerSystem: Timer System: Each player has a time limit for their turn (configurable when creating tables)
flowItems.cardAnimation: Card Animation: Watch cards being played with smooth animations
flowItems.realtimeUpdates: Real-time Updates: See all game actions as they happen

rules.biddingDescription: When it's your turn to bid, you'll see a bidding interface with the following options:

biddingItems.bidAmount: Bid Amount: Use the slider or buttons to select your bid (50-100 points)
biddingItems.trumpSuit: Trump Suit: Choose hearts ♥, diamonds ♦, clubs ♣, or spades ♠
biddingItems.passButton: Pass Button: Click "Pass" if you don't want to bid
biddingItems.visualFeedback: Visual Feedback: See current bids and who has passed
biddingItems.timer: Timer: Watch the countdown timer for your turn

rules.biddingRulesText: Minimum bid is 50, all bids must be multiples of 5, and each bid must be higher than the last. Once you pass, you cannot bid again in that round.
rules.playingDescription: When it's your turn to play a card, you'll see your hand at the bottom of the screen. Here's how to play:

playingItems.clickToPlay: Click to Play: Click on any card in your hand to play it
playingItems.followSuit: Follow Suit: You must play a card of the same suit as the lead card if you have one
playingItems.trumpOrDiscard: Trump or Discard: If you can't follow suit, you can play any card (trump or discard)
playingItems.visualCues: Visual Cues: The interface highlights valid plays and shows the current trick
playingItems.cardValues: Card Values: Focus on winning tricks with Aces, 10s, 5s, and 6s (in 40-card games)

rules.playingTip: Strategy Tip: Try to win tricks containing point cards while avoiding giving away valuable cards to opponents.
rules.scoringDescription: The game interface automatically tracks all scores and displays them in real-time. You can see:

scoringItems.teamScores: Team Scores: Current cumulative scores for both teams
scoringItems.roundScores: Round Scores: Points earned in the current round
scoringItems.bidStatus: Bid Status: Whether the contractor made their bid
scoringItems.cardPoints: Card Points: Value of cards won in each trick
scoringItems.gameProgress: Game Progress: How close each team is to the target score

rules.scoringRulesText: If the contractor's team makes their bid, they add their card points to their score. If they fail, they subtract the bid amount. The defending team always adds their card points to their score.
rules.scoringExample: Example: Scores are NS:120, EW:100. NS bid 75.
rules.scoringExample1: • If NS take 85 card points, their new score is 205 and they win the game.
rules.scoringExample2: • If NS take 75 card points, their new score is 195. If East or West bid they score their 25 points for a cumulative score of 125; if they both just passed their score stays at 100.
rules.scoringExample3: • If NS take 70 card points they lose the 75 they bid and their score is now 45. EW can score their 30 points provided that one of them bid for a total of 130; if both just passed their score stays at 100.
rules.negativeScore: A team's cumulative score can be negative. On the score sheet this is usually shown by drawing a box around the number - for example minus 95 is written as ⬜95⬜. The team is said to be "in the box", or sometimes "in the hole" (shown by a circle rather than a box around the score). Failing in a contract is sometimes known as being "boxed".
rules.winningCondition: The first team to achieve a score of 200 points or more wins the game. If both teams reach 200 or more on the same deal then the bidding team wins.
rules.losingCondition: The game also ends if one team reaches a negative score of 200 or worse while the other team's score is positive or zero. In that case the team with minus 200 or worse loses the game.
rules.kittyDescription: When you create a table with the 40-card deck option, you can enable the Kitty feature for an exciting variant of the game.

kittyItems.kittyCards: Kitty Cards: 4 cards are dealt face-down in the center of the table
kittyItems.kittyInterface: Kitty Interface: When you win the bid, you'll see a special kitty interface
kittyItems.takeKitty: Take Kitty: Click "Take Kitty" to add the 4 kitty cards to your hand
kittyItems.discardCards: Discard Cards: Select 4 cards from your hand to discard back to the kitty
kittyItems.kittyPoints: Kitty Points: Any point cards in the discarded kitty go to the defending team

rules.kittyStrategy: Strategy: The kitty adds an extra layer of strategy - you might get valuable cards, but you must discard 4 cards back, and any points in those discarded cards help your opponents!

additionalItems.botDifficulty: Bot Difficulty: Choose from Easy, Medium, Hard, or Acadien bot skill levels
additionalItems.realtimeUpdates: Real-time Updates: See all game actions as they happen with smooth animations
